subject: Football
Colleges and Universities
lead_paragraph: Clemson running back Ray Ray McElrathbey, who took custody of his 12-year-old brother last year, will miss the season after sustaining a torn anterior cruciate ligament in his knee Thursday during practice, the spokesman Tim Bourret confirmed yesterday.The injury comes a month after McElrathbey had arthroscopic knee surgery. Last year, he took his brother, Fahmarr, to live with him because of their mother’s drug addiction.
snippet: Clemson running back Ray Ray McElrathbey, who took custody of his 12-year-old brother last year, will miss the season after sustaining a torn anterior cruciate ligament in his knee Thursday during practice, the spokesman Tim Bourret confirmed...
